definition[0]: a bright shine on a surface
example[0]: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
example[1]: The silverware had been polished to a high gloss.
definition[1]: an attractive appearance on the surface of something that may hide something less pleasant
example[2]: Beneath the gloss of success was a tragic private life.
example[3]: The injury to Keane took the gloss off Manchester United’s victory.
definition[2]: a note in a piece of writing that explains a difficult word, phrase, or idea
definition[3]: a description or explanation that makes something seem more attractive or acceptable than it really is
example[4]: The minister was accused of putting a gloss on the government’s poor performance.
definition[4]: paint that looks shiny after it dries
definition[5]: to provide a note in a piece of writing, explaining a difficult word, phrase, or idea
